snippet: A resentencing fight reflects a wide and disturbing pattern.
abstract: Editorial calls on Texas to grant new sentencing hearing to Duane Buck, man who remains on death row for murder charges despite proof that racism played major role in his trial and emergence of significant new evidence in his favor; holds that case reflects wide and disturbing pattern of racial bias in death penalty cases and amounts to yet more evidence that capital punishment should be abolished.
lead_paragraph: A resentencing fight reflects a wide and disturbing pattern.
